body.en: For the past 3+ years, I've been working really close to known companies from around the world, doing <u class="text-white">web consulting</u> & <u class="text-white">project assessments</u>. These are some of the most remarkable projects I've had the fortune to develop and <u class="text-white">see in action</u>:

I've spent a major part of the past couple years working on <u class="text-white">web development</u>, <u class="text-white">ai-related</u> stuff & <u class="text-white">small interesting projects</u>. Some of them are:

He dedicado gran parte de los a√±os pasados trabajando en <u class="text-white">desarrollo web</u>, <u class="text-white">inteligencia artificial</u> y <u class="text-white">peque√±as aplicaciones</u>. Algunos de estos proyectos son:

pictureCaption.en: Visual Studio Code along iTerm2 with Google Sans Mono @ 12px
pictureCaption.es: Visual Studio Code junto a iTerm2 con Google Sans Mono @ 12px

body.en: I'm a big fan of building my own tools & making them look as I feel comfortable with. This, of course, involves the colors on my text editor of choice (Visual Studio Code) and my terminal emulator (iTerm2). That's why I created my own colorscheme, VSCode Gabriel.
body.es: Soy un gran fan de construir mis propias herramientas y hacerlas ver tal cual me gusta. Esto, por supuesto, involucra mi editor de texto de preferencia (Visual Studio Code) y mi emulador de terminal (iTerm2). Es por ello que hice mi propio esquema de colores, VSCode Gabriel.

bottomText.en: You can download it in the Visual Studio Code Marketplace, or by opening the command palette with ‚åò p (or ^ p if you're on Windows) and typing in ext install gabriel, I'm sure you'll recognize it. Aditionally, you can copy the terminal's 16 color palette and copy it to your preferred terminal emulator if you want to match it with the editor as I do.
bottomText.es: Puedes descargarla en el Marketplace de Visual Studio Code, o abriendo la paleta de comandos con ‚åò p (o ^ p si estas en Windows) y escribiendo ext install gabriel, s√© que lo reconocer√°s cuando lo veas. Adicionalmente, puedes copiar la paleta de 16 colores del terminal integrado a tu emulador de preferencia si deseas combinarlo con el editor como lo hago yo.
